Class AbstractRobot

java.lang.Object
uk.ac.keele.csc20004.robots.AbstractRobot
All Implemented Interfaces:
Robot
Direct Known Subclasses:
CycloBot, HumanoidRobot, WheeledRobot
public abstract class AbstractRobot extends Object implements Robot
Abstract class defining the main methods for a generic Robot. Note that you cannot directly create instances of this class: it's abstract, and it does not define the parts it's composed of. Rather, you should use the appropriate derived classes or create your own.
Author:
marcoortolani

  • Constructor Details

    • AbstractRobot

      protected AbstractRobot(String name, Frame frame, Motor[] motorParts, Sensor[] sensorParts, Actuator[] actuatorParts)
      The constructor allows to create robots with any combination of parts; however, there must always be a Motor, a Frame and an Actuator. The idea is that constructors of derived classes will take care of creating robots according to specifications.
      Parameters:
      name - a mnemonic name for identifying this robot
      frame - a part of type Frame
      motorParts - an array of parts for the Motor section of the robot
      sensorParts - an array of parts for the Sensor section of the robot
      actuatorParts - an array of parts for the Actuator section of the robot

  • Method Details

      public int getNumParts()

      Specified by:

      Returns:
      the number of parts of this robot

    • refillFrameEnergy

      public void refillFrameEnergy(RepairBay bay)
      This methods "repairs" the frame by refilling its energy levels. If the frame energy is not zero, it does nothing. It requires a RepairBay object to operate.
      Specified by:
      refillFrameEnergy in interface Robot
      Parameters:
      bay - the RepairBay object that is used to refill the energy levels

    • refillMotorEnergy

      public void refillMotorEnergy(RepairBay bay)
      This methods "repairs" the motor parts by refilling their energy levels. If the motor energy is not zero, it does nothing. It requires a RepairBay object to operate.
      Specified by:
      refillMotorEnergy in interface Robot
      Parameters:
      bay - the RepairBay object that is used to refill the energy levels

    • refillSensorsEnergy

      public void refillSensorsEnergy(RepairBay bay)
      This methods "repairs" the sensor parts by refilling their energy levels. If the sensor energy is not zero, it does nothing. It requires a RepairBay object to operate.
      Specified by:
      refillSensorsEnergy in interface Robot
      Parameters:
      bay - the RepairBay object that is used to refill the energy levels

      public void refillActuatorsEnergy(RepairBay bay)

      Specified by:

    • attack

      public void attack(Robot r)
      If any of the energy levels is zero, the robot cannot attack. The attack is implemented in practice by calling the fendOff() method of the attacked robot (which decreases its energy levels as appropriate)
      Specified by:
      attack in interface Robot
      Parameters:
      r - the reference to the Robot object to be attacked

    • fendOff

      public double fendOff(double strikeCoefficient)
      This method implements the response to an attack. It basically causes a delay (simulating the time needed for the attack) and decreases the energy level of this robot's parts as appropriate.
      Specified by:
      fendOff in interface Robot
      Parameters:
      strikeCoefficient - the strength of the strike (i.e. the attack coefficient of the attacker)
      Returns:
      the energy level of the robot after the attack

    • getPartsDescriptions

      public String getPartsDescriptions()
      Returns a a string describing the composing parts of this robot
      Returns:
      a string describing the composing parts of this robot

      the name of this robot

    • toString

      public String toString()
      A (short) descriptive string for this robot. It contains the name and the overall energy of the robot.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      the short description of this robot
